alert.note: Alert for Grant (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Grant County through 630 PM MDT... At 545 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hyannis, or 27 miles north of Arthur, moving southeast at 80 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hyannis, Pratt Lake, Spring Valley Lake, Green Lake and Cogill Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 145 and 149. Highway 61 between mile markers 139 and 156. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
